posts.name: BillDunlap
posts.cooked:
Last week we received two XRPs (from Sparkfun) and the students put them together.  I brought one home to try and am having trouble connecting to it via the simulation path.  (I have never used wpilib’s simulation before.)

I followed the instructions in [ Getting Started with XRP — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation ] to image the robot (with xrp-wpilib-firmware-1.0.0.uf2). My web browser can connect to http://192.168.42.1:5000/ and displays the expected json file.

{ “configVersion”: 1, “network”: { “defaultAP”: { “ssid”: “XRP-8373-4132”, “password”: “xrp-wpilib” }, “networkList”: [ { “ssid”: “Test Network”, “password”: “Test Password” } ], “mode”: “AP” } }

Using the latest (alpha) version of wpilib, I copied the xrp example program to my home folder and hit the ‘simulate …’ menu item from the W menu.  The Simulation UI pops up and and shows lots of stuff: the controller’s joysticks and buttons are registered there, but there seems to be no connection to the robot.  The console window of VS Code shows

link_counts.title: Getting Started with XRP — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked:
you already connected via the WiFi I’m assuming.

I also sometimes had to power cycle the XRP before it connected.

It sounds like you moved the controller onto the joystick already.

edit: To the XRP- network.  You may have to disconnect from other internet.
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: BillDunlap
posts.cooked:
Sorry about the truncated post - something in it caused a 403 error when trying to post it.

The console output included

posts.name: BillDunlap
posts.cooked: Yes, it is connected via WiFi.  I can ping it and http to its port 5000.

reply_to_user.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked:
Also make sure teleop is enabled. In the simulator.

The console output looks normal to me.
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
BillDunlap:

(with xrp-wpilib-firmware-1.0.0.uf2)

BillDunlap:

Using the latest (alpha) version of wpilib

The alpha version of wpilib was compatible with older xrp firmware, but I’m pretty sure you need beta 2 or 3 for xrp firmware 1.0.

posts.name: BillDunlap
posts.cooked:
Thanks!  Installing beta-3 of the 2024 Wpilib did the trick.

-Bill
